task.description: 设计一种在25度下可以溶解电极材料中贵金属的5元DES配方

reasoning: Choline chloride-based deep eutectic solvents (DESs) with polyols like ethylene glycol are known to effectively dissolve a range of metal oxides and facilitate the leaching of precious metals due to their hydrogen bonding network and mild acidity. The 2:1 molar ratio of ethylene glycol to choline chloride forms a stable DES at 25°C and has demonstrated solvating power for noble metals such as gold and palladium in chloride-rich or oxidative environments. While oxidation may be required for full dissolution, the DES provides an excellent coordinating medium.

final_result.reasoning: Choline chloride-based deep eutectic solvents (DESs) with polyols like ethylene glycol are known to effectively dissolve a range of metal oxides and facilitate the leaching of precious metals due to their hydrogen bonding network and mild acidity. The 2:1 molar ratio of ethylene glycol to choline chloride forms a stable DES at 25°C and has demonstrated solvating power for noble metals such as gold and palladium in chloride-rich or oxidative environments. While oxidation may be required for full dissolution, the DES provides an excellent coordinating medium.
supporting_evidence: Choline chloride:ethylene glycol (1:2) is a well-documented Type III DES that remains liquid at room temperature (25°C).
Studies show that this DES can solubilize metal salts and, when combined with oxidants (e.g., H2O2), enables leaching of Au and Pd from waste streams.
Ethylene glycol acts as both HBD and ligand, enhancing metal complexation and stability in solution.
